title: recovering data from an Huawei P10

thread.text:
As you may have already guessed I have a Huawei P10 mobile phone and I use this sometimes a sound recorder for when I do research and interviews.
Today I stupidly deleted one of my recordings which is super important.
When I look into recovering the data it seems I have to root the phone which I have no problem in doing, but I read that I also have to unlock the bootloader and this will erase everything on my phone. So it's not something I want to do.
So is there any way I can recover my sound file or is it lost forever?

Rooting will probably not be a guarantee that it'll work either, unfortunately. If the file wasn't backed up elsewhere (on another device or to a cloud service) or if your recorder doesn't have a 'Trash bin' option, the file will be VERY hard to recover even for low-level apps that might try to rebuild the data.
First use an Android data recovery software to scan out your Huawei P10 to see if you can scan out the deleted files out. If yes, you can recover them, if no, there is no way to get them back.

title: Sharing events on calendar.

thread.text:
Not sure if I'm asking in the right place....
My wife has a P10 and I have a Huawei Nova. We both use the same Gmail account. If we add events to Google calendar on a PC we can both see the event on our phones. Fine, no problem.
If I add an event using the huawei native calendar on my phone it shows up on the PC google calendar but not on my wifes phone.......same problem if my wife creates an event on her phone, it shows on PC google calendar but not on my phone.....fine most of the time....
.....but if I want to create and event on my phone for both of us, how do I do it? 
Everything synced as far as I can tell. Both displaying on the same calendars in settings.
Thanks in advance.

Are the events missing even after some time has passed (e.g. 30 minutes) or after a manual sync? Sometimes it takes a while before new events are completely synced.
Alternatively, you can try installing the Google Calendar app from the Play Store, which should sync without any problems.

Yes, events not syncing even after several days.
After trawling around other sites I fear you are right. It seems the only solution is to ditch the native Huawei calendar and install the google one. Shame, I prefer the Huawei layout....oh well, thanks for responding.

The blurry camera could be caused by overheat of CPU or hot weather. And it could also be caused by scratched camera glass.
1. If your camera glass is not clean or get scratched, replace the camera glass or back housing.
2. Go Settings_Apps_Camera. Force stop the camera and go Storage_Clean DATA 
3. If forementioned solutions are still not working. You need to replace the rear camera https://www.witrigs.com/oem-rear-camera-for-huawei-p10 You can follow the video in the page to replace the camera.

title: Huawei P10 - Videos under MONOCHROME Mode

thread.text:
Hi guys! I was wondering if it is possible to shoot a video in monochrome mode. It would be awesome, and with more quality given that the sensor is bigger than the color one. But....i haven't found anything about it.
Greetings from ARG!
Manu

replies.text: The sensor is not really bigger, basically the same size. The RGB sensor is 1/2.8” and the monochrome sensor is 1/2.9”. The monochrome has more pixels but they are ca 20% smaller than the pixels on the RGB sensor.

thread.text: I have looked around for the same and also looked around at XDA for it. But it doesn't seem to exist a working solution for it. I know the Essential phone has it, so it should be possible to do. Monochrome video and monochrome RAW is top of my whish list

Yes, my bad. I know that the sensors are almost the same size, but the quality, sharpness, and contrast that you have on a monochrome photo would make an awesome video too. So.... Do you know if there's a chance to do it?

You can check FiLMic Pro for the video. It’s not free whoever they have a free app that will tell you which features of FiLMic Pro the phone supports. 
I’m haven’t been in the Android world for a while now. I know FiLMic Pro allows me to change cameras on my phone. 
Also, regarding photos, I would suggest you check out some of the available 3rd party camera apps that are available. I know some allow you to switch cameras and also will make photos in raw. I don’t have any suggestions on which ones. I simply don’t remember much about the Android camera apps. 
I still have a Mate 9 but have not used it in a long time. Maybe I’ll knock the dust off of it, fire it up and see if I can remember anything.
BTW, FiLMic Pro is one of the best, if not the best, video apps around. You have full manual control, resolution, frame rate, bit rate, aspect ratio (even 2.39 which is true cinematic ratio and coupled with 24 FPS produces some great cin video) and it even allows you to film in flat gamma and log gamma if you want. That’s so great for color grading in post processing adjusting yourself or using LUTs. Again this all depends on which feature the phone has.

Forgot to mention regarding FiLMic Pro manual controls. Also you have full control of ISO and shutter speed. You can lock focus and exposure. Also you can preset push and pull focus points and adjust the speed with which the camera will push and pull to those points.

title: P10 plus camera app

thread.text:
Hello there! 
p10 plus has exceptional camera and optics for its price. It's great for when I don't want to carry DSLR and bunch of objectives with me. So why is the app so useless considering video recording? First of all, none of the 3rd party apps I've tried can handle p10's camera hardware thus manual settings are out of the question. Every single scenario, except for sunny day, is impossible for this software. When the image quality isn't entirely useless the artificial lighting causes flickering, because you can't control the shutter speed. When there's no flickering quality is something out off year 2000 camera phones.
So my question is; Have any of you found any app etc. that gains manual control over shutter speed? Or is there any way to tweak official app or anything? Or maybe MagicLantern-like hack?

Try FilMic Pro. I haven’t used it on Android, however on IOS it’s simply the best video app. It’s not free but there is a free test version that will tell you which of its features the phone will support. On IOS you can adjust the shutter speed.

title: Email notification badge

thread.text:
I just made the switch from iOS to Android and the thing I have noticed I'd that the email badge notifications do not seem to work for Gmail or Outlook app (interesting it's there for the builtin mail app and even Facebook).
I don't want to pay for Nova Launcher which I have read as a workaround. 
Can someone confirm the issue is because of Nougat and its not just a setting?
Should we have the feature in Oreo? If so any idea when this will be released for us?
Thanks.

Welcome to Android Central! Unread count badges in stock launchers are typically only for certain apps -- it's the same on my old Honor 5X as well, running EMUI 4.0. To have unread count badges on every app that serves up notifications, you probably need to install a 3rd party launcher like Nova, or an app like Notifyer Unread Count.

Thanks for the information. Are you aware if this will be a feature for us in Android Oreo 8? It seems like they have full notification features but I guess it depends on Huawei and what modification is they ms key to the OS before rolling out.
Also do you know if there is a release date for p10?

The Oreo feature are notification 'dots'. Just dots, no numbers.
Again how it will work on Huawei would depend on how they code their launcher.

Android will support badges on a system level with version 8, so the update should fix this issue for you. The beta-test is happening now and unverified source mentioned the end of February for a roll out. But a staged roll out might mean it could be another month or more before it hits YOUR device .

title: p10 display problem

thread.text: Hi guys. I'm having problems with my P10. I have bought a second-hand P10, 6 months old and in mint condition. I removed the factory plastic film and put a tempered glass on. The next day I noticed that i see white digitizer lines and discoloration around the touched area even on light presses. I have removed the glass and after about 15 minutes without the display protector, the things returned to normal. I put this down to poor protector quality. I used it like that for 2 days, with no issues. Then, I decided to put a new plastic film to avoid accidental scratches. After only 10 minutes, to my surprise, I noticed the same distortions on the display. Upon googling for a bit, I learnt that my phone may be suffering from static electricity problem. Is this correct, and if so, do I RMA? The display distortions from the electricity are most noticable when you try to remove the plastic film looking at the display at the same time.... After the removal, the things seem to stabilize.... Any suggestions welcome. (if important, both the plastic film and the glass were no name products)

replies.text: One thing I Iforgot to mention, the phone is from an early batch and without an oleophpobic coating...

thread.text:

Not sure if they will rma it though being that you aren't the original owner but didn't hurt to try

replies.text: Ty for your reply. Rma will not be the problem. I will try with the more expensive screen protector first. It occured to me that the cheap ones might not be anti-static. Also, the person who put the glass on didnt use the anti-static wipe, only a micro-fiber cloth... If i Rma i will pray that the tech person not remove the glass...

In my experience, I have used cheap plastic and glass screen protectors and never experienced the that you are having, although I don't have this phone, so can't say in this specific case. Worth a shot to try a better one for sure, just don't think it will make a difference.

thread.text: Ive been asking around.. The problem sems to be the absence of the oleophobic coating, which results in the build up of static electricity... Only the early p10 models came without this coating.... The phone has gorilla glass 5 so I decided to keep it in the original folder case without glasses, films and stuff....

How long do the phones go before you start seeing the battery dying?

Generally speaking you have to types of aging woes. All batteries will lose charge over time. It goes 8 hours on a charge, then 7.5 h then 6 h then 5 h and so on. Keep it charged and carry a battery pack and it's a very minor annoyance.
The bigger issue is when it can't handle the load. You have 60% battery and boot up a heavy app and the phone dies. This can happen due to a faulty battery very early or even with the best of batteries creep up over time.
On a personal note my Xperia Z3 went around 18 months before it was difficult to keep it charged. I didn't check Twitter and browse webpages on the morning train unless it was plugged in. Because I wanted it to stay charged over the rest of the day. Around the 24 month mark it started to die unexpectedly when the load became too much. And that's when I got a new phone!
Why didn't you just change the battery? Wouldn't that have been cheaper?

It was close to 2 years old so I could have taken it on warranty and I figured maybe the battery as well. But it also had taken a few bumps, nothing serious but might be enough to screw me on the warranty.
So I looked what my carrier had to offer and the P10 Plus with a discount in the 400-500$ range and a MediaPad T3 10 with 4G thrown in as well. Figured it wasn't such a bad deal

I thought it was only a battery issue in which case it didn't make sense to buy a new phone just for that. But since it had other issues plus you can get a deal on the new phone then it made sense to upgrade

title: Alarm and sound issues with Huawei P10 Plus

thread.text:
Hello,
I just got this Huawei P10 plus and notice that my alarm doesn't actually sound when it is set. It goes off, I can see it on my home screen when I look at it first thing in the morning but it's not actually making sound - UNLESS I press the alarm notification, then I will hear my melody.
I have nothing blocked, nothing muted, alarm volume up all the way, I've made sure every, single, thing that could possibly be related to my alarm, sounds, or notifications are open and yet, it still will not actually sound when it goes off.
I'm frustrated because it's very difficult to get tech support from Huawei, their support number is international (I live in Canada) so I feel like I'm at a bit of a loss. 
Before anyone suggests to me that I install a 3rd party app, I'd like to get this understood/remedied just based on principle. This is a brand new phone, and the alarm should work. Yes, I'm stubborn.
Relating to sound as well, I activated "OK Google" while I was sitting at a red light, to dictate a text message, I noticed that the little bouncy bars enabled, however, my phone was not speaking back to me. Again, nothing was muted, disabled, at a low volume.
My sound works otherwise, it rings, I can play music, I can hear power up tones, etc.
It's just these finicky issues that are driving me bonkers - I like it when a new phone actually does what it's supposed to.

I know you don't want to hear about 3rd party apps but maybe just testing one out to see if it makes a sound when it goes off. That'll tell you if the first party alarm app I'd not working or it's something more engrained in the os.

I can think of two things, because my alarms are flawless. Almost a bit better then on other phones I have had.
1) There is a setting in Alarms, Settings to allow alarms when sound is off. See the attached screenshot.
2) Make sure alarms are allowed in "do not disturb". Flipping the switch as described in 1 seems to more or less override the settings here, but always good to make sure.
If this doesn't help I don't know what else could be wrong. I hope you find a solution.

Update: I called my provider's tech support and we figured out that if DND was enabled - whether as a schedule or just arbitrarily, that it would not sound the alarm despite it being configured to allow alarms only.
So, that's annoying. 
Now I'm going to do some more digging to see if there's a workaround.

Thanks, Snapphane! I just posted an update above, I found the problem and it did have to do with DND.
I assume you have a P10 Plus running Nougat, too? If so, can I ask you for a favour? Can you, just as an experiment, enable your DND to allow alarms-only, and then set your default alarm to go off while DND is enabled? 
I know you mentioned your alarms were working flawlessly, but, our settings are exact (except I have snooze with the volume button), but I'm curious if your default alarm will still sound when your phone's DND is on, with alarms.
I'm really curious to see if you have the same issue as I'm having!

Yeah, Android 7.0 with the B170 build.
I have a similar setup to you, I'm running DND but I allow "priority notifications".
I switched to "only alarms" and for this one test my alarm rang as supposed. Not sure why yours isn't working. Try using a more "standard" ringtone, might be that the system doesn't like whatever you've picked?

Settings - Apps - then press the settings button at the bottom of the screen - special access - ignore battery optimization - show all.

title: Best camera settings for kids/pets

thread.text:
New user here and I'm still finding my way around the P 10 Plus (and EMUI). The camera is great and a clear step up from my Sony Z3. BUT...
The Sony phone had a "sport" option for the camera. This helped getting a sort of decent picture as the kid runs and jumps around. Yes, it cranks the ISO but gets rid of some/most motion blur. The only option in the Huawei camera app seems to be going to manual mode.
Anyone out there with a few tips and tricks on the matter?

What sports mode did was increase the shutter speed to reduce blur. You'll need to play around in manual yourself to get the hang of it, but you can manually increase ISO to make it more light sensitive and increase shutter speed to reduce blur.
If you don't know much about how a camera works, it functions by opening the lens to capture light and create an image. The longer the lens is open, the more light it let's in but any motion caught will blur, and hand shake causing the camera module itself to move makes the entire image appear blurry. 
A fast shutter speed allows the lens to open and close extremely quick freezing motion and preventing blur, this is what sports mode would do. However because it opens and closes so fast, it doesn't get much time to capture light so the sensor needs to increase ISO (light sensitivity) to make up for it. Downside to increased ISO is the lower image quality and digital noise it adds. 
The exact results vary between cameras so I can't give you specific settings, but just so you know 1/100 is a faster shutter speed than 1/50, it's measured as a fraction of a second.
I can shoot just fine in manual, as I stated. But for a quick snap anything that's automatic is a lot fast with less hassle.
Yeah a Sports Mode would be good for us with pets and young kids. The best option we have however is Burst Mode and hope one of two of those rapid shots are clean

The launcher (TSF) also allows you to set up a slide out dock on the left or right side of the screen to access more apps at the flick of a finger.

title: My Review on the Huawei P10

thread.text:
Well, the P10 is probably overshadowed by the G6, and S8 now. But the phone was just recently released in Singapore where I live. Got my hands on one since I was really impressed with the Mate 9. And it's pretty much like a smaller Mate 9 (which is a good thing to me).
It's a phone that gets most of the basics right. Good performance, decent camera, nice design, decent battery life, etc.
It's lacking stereo speakers (which i enjoyed on the Mate 9) but it still sounds really good. The bezels are a bit big, but at least there's no camera hump and phone is still really thin. No water resistance which is a bit of a downer. But in Singapore, the price is still quite decent at least (less than 700SGD, or around 500USD). Which is important because the P10 probably wouldn't be able to win the S8, but since it's cheaper, I still think it's a pretty decent option.
At this point, I think Samsung is so far ahead of other Android OEMs in terms of hardware that it's going to be difficult to be able to just jump to their level straight away. But Huawei is improving at least.
Anyway, video review if anyone is interested.

Thank you for the review. I also own the Huawei P10 and I'm fully satisfied with it. My only gripe is the screen which is missing the oleophobic coating which makes it very smudge-prone. Battery is really good and lasts me throughout the day. Generally very happy with my decision to get this phone now. S8 on the way though

replies.text: Thanks! I think the P10 is a pretty good phone too. I don't mind the oleophobic coating much since I have a screen protector on my phones anyway. But for those who doesn't like using screen protector, I can see it being a major annoyance. Kinda peculiar since the Mate 9 had it. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
How come you have this phone if is not even out yet?
I think it depends on where you live. It was officially released where I live a couple of days back.

thread.text: Release dates vary by market but there's always Ebay if you're in a hurry to get your hands on one.

It's still a brand/manufacturer that's not as well known as Samsung and others; which is unfortunate because I think their devices are great but underrated. I have an Honor 8 and most people have no clue what it is, but tell me they like it/like how it looks. I'm hoping that once Huawei gets some more brand recognition, its sales will improve and maybe one day, it will be a top contender.

title: Decisions - HP10P or Honor 8 Pro, or wait?!

Available now:
- Honor 8 Pro
- Huawei P10 Plus
Wait for:

title: Does Huawei P10 support MHL/HDMI?

thread.text: Planning on getting the phone, I'm wonder whether it supports MHL/HDMI or not. Hoping I could attach it to my TV/Monitor using just a wire

Hello!
This is a very good question! After looking into it a little further there are quite a few conflicting reports. However, none of the reports actually can confirm MHL/HDMI support. I would say based on the phones production date, and the movement towards wireless screen mirroring, I would probably say it does not. I can confirm it does supprot miracast and of course Chromecast usage. However, if you do want to go the cable route, you can find a USB C to HDMI adapter on Amazon from $13-20. Worst case scenario you purchase and it doesn't work, you can always return for a full refund. Given the small amount for the cable might be worth a try!

title: Fingerprint scanner asking for password every 3 days

thread.text:
My partner had just bought the Huawei P10 3 days ago. 
It's been working fine, but today when he tried unlocking the phone with the fingerprint scanner it wouldn't work and asked for a password.
It also said that the password would be required every 3 days.
Is there any way this can be turned off and just use the fingerprint scanner? 
Any help would be appreciated

Welcome to Android Central! This is actually the norm for Nexus devices (https://support.google.com/nexus/answer/6285273?hl=en):
"Unlock with your backup method
For security, you'll need to use your backup PIN, pattern, or password:
When your fingerprint isn't recognized after a few tries
After restarting (rebooting) your device
After switching to a different user on the deviceAfter more than 48 hours have passed since you last unlocked using your backup method"

replies.text:
I know about this, but he hadn't done anything different and it says the password will need to be changed every 3 days. 
This doesn't seem normal. My Samsung doesn't do that.

thread.text: It says the password has to be changed every 3 days, or it says it has to be re-entered every 3 days? If the latter, it might be something the manufacturer added as an informational message for the users. Users are often not aware of this requirement, and therefore don't realize how important it is to remember their backup password, so perhaps the manufacturer realized this and added that message as a reminder.

title: Huawei P10 - help

thread.text: Hi, I need help. I have Huawei P10, and I have a demo mode. Can you help me ? I tried factory reset or disable this app and nothing. Always remain demo. Please help me, I need some new ROM, but do not know where. well thank you.!

Welcome to Android Central! Where did you get the phone? If it was a floor demo model, it may have a special demo ROM installed, in which case you'd have to root the phone and flash the stock ROM, if available. The forums at XDA-developers.com is a good place to look for that kind of thing.
I assume you've already looked through the system settings to see if there's an option to turn off Demo Mode, right? One of my colleagues also suggested looking in Developer Options.

Hey, I got it as a gift. What specifically in developer settings, you think?
I look at this web page. Thanks so far!
If it's there, it would be an option for Demo Mode. But it's not there for every phone.
I found it, but it's turned off.

It looks like that Demo Mode is different from the kind of demo mode you see on a floor model (i.e., where it automatically plays what is essentially a big ad for the phone): Android N Dev Preview 3: Demo Mode Is Back, Now In Developer Settings. This makes me think that the issue is with the ROM that's installed on the phone. You'll have to look into rooting the phone and installing the stock ROM, as I mentioned before. Sorry, but I don't have any expertise in that.

title: Organic Minimalism

thread.text: The 5.1" P10 keeps the Leica optics of the P9, whereas the 5.5" P10 Plus has improvements to that.
